lexUnit.name: wake.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emerge or cause to emerge from a state of sleep; stop sleeping.

sentence.text: And Meg told the watching millions that her mum hammered on his door and woke him from a nap during a break in filming .
He had promised her that if anything out of the ordinary happened , any unnecessary flicker on a dial , he would wake her .
She crept stealthily along the gallery , not daring to put on a light in case she should wake Luke , past his room , feeling carefully in the half-darkness .
She would wake the dead .
Young Keely Smith woke her sleeping dad Paul , who found his Middlesbrough terrace house thick with smoke in the early hours of yesterday .
The sun woke Lily in the morning .
Charlie let those who could , sleep , and did n't attempt to wake anyone until three o'clock the next morning .
The hotel manager woke me at 10 a.m. with a telegram from my mother , which had been delayed .
The next morning Dad woke him at eight .
They wake you at five a.m. , which is when I 'm often going to bed , and you 're so knackered by mid-morning that you doze all day . "
The wind woke her at six , hustling the leaves on the trees , still green in November .
He burst into the apartment , woke Constance from her doze , and fell upon her , greedy and desperate to prove to himself that he was right and his friend was wrong .
And one rustle of the packet wakes Darren from the deepest sleep .
At five a lone bugle woke his companions from their drowsy slumber .
After a long time , a familiar voice woke them from their lazy reverie .
The 15-month-old boy 's screams woke his mother in the early hours .
A friend of Soon-Yi said : ` Mia would wake her daughter in the middle of the night and scream at her : ` Look what you 've done to me -- how could this happen ? " '

My watch alarm woke us to a finger cold pre-dawn , though I remained only half awake as we trudged through knee-deep snow to the bottom of the Supercouloir , both of us cursing that we had not brought our skis .
Then Mrs Dempster woke him as usual with a cup of tea , and he felt better .
Shall we wake them with a happy tune
She woke Lucy with coffee , and more loving , sure and slow .
Finally get to sleep at five , thinking : ` I do n't care who runs the country , as long as he does n't wake me before noon . "
Sarah Anne Burke was critically ill last night after being found lying in her bed covered in blood by a care assistant who went in to wake her for breakfast .
The alarm clock woke Claudia for the second time and she sniffed appreciatively at the aroma penetrating her room .
Thunder woke her out of a fitful sleep .
After waking the guestmaster by tolling the abbey gate bell , Corbett was greeted by an anxious Prior and a solicitous Ranulf .
Shall I wake the boss ? "
“ I 'll wake you . ”
Romanov was woken by the ringing of the phone .
I was woken by the full moon shining in on me , as I had forgotten to draw my curtains .
That night Tess was woken by a noise in the house .
She was woken at seven by the night nurses who had to tidy her up before they went off duty .
Owen Ruddy , who lives near the scene of the crime , described how he was woken from his sleep by the noise .
You did n't like being woken in the middle of the night for ice cream , but you sat up and ate it in bed before it melted to please your father .
I was woken in the middle of the night by a phone call … ”
The maid who had woken her stared back without comprehension or interest .
But you can wake me again , if you like . "
I 'd wake Zaria and get her out pronto , then bell the local Bill .
Alter a milky drink she settled and slept until woken by the nurses for a cup of tea at 6.30 am .
She woke when the machine bumped something .
